description.value: The commandant can take the Dash or Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.
The commandant can take the Dash or Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.
*Ranged Weapon Attack:* +7 to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. *Hit:* 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.
*Ranged Weapon Attack:* +7 to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. *Hit:* 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.
*Melee Weapon Attack:* +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning damage.

The Eel's weapon attacks are magical. When the eel hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3 (1d6) lightning damage (included in the attack).

The Pilot Eel can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

If the skeleton takes psychic damage, it must make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 10, or half the psychic damage it took, whichever is greater. On a failed save, the skeleton is stunned until the end of its next turn. Additionally on a failed save, roll a die. On an odd result, the eel is driven from the body, exiting prone in an unoccupied space within 5 ft. of the skeleton. The skeleton then immediately reverts to inanimate remains.

If the skeleton takes psychic damage, it must make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 10, or half the psychic damage it took, whichever is greater. On a failed save, the skeleton is stunned until the end of its next turn. Additionally on a failed save, roll a die. On an odd result, the eel is driven from the body, exiting prone in an unoccupied space within 5 ft. of the skeleton. The skeleton then immediately reverts to inanimate remains.
The commandant makes two attacks with its cutlass.
The commandant makes two attacks with its cutlass.

Once per turn.

the commandant deals an extra 10 (3d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally of the commandant that isn't incapacitated and the commandant doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

biography.value:
***Ideal.*** The commandant sketches a wavy, pyramid-like shape on her notepad and then circles the top. (She believes that knowledge is the path to power and domination.)

 

***Bond.*** The commandant sketches many small pyramids and then draws lightning-bolt arrows connecting each of them to the larger one. (She knows that the regiment is the most important—soldiers come and go—and that she is the regiment.)

 

***Flaw*** The commandant hisses in laughter at the characters’ actions; saltwater foam spills out from her anemone breathing-mask. (She believes that everyone is beneath her, and thus that her plans will always succeed.)
